The apartment will have a private washer and dryer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a charming private balcony in the rear which is dedicated solely to this apartment!A beautiful mature oak tree reaches up from the ground level providing a nice ambiance in the summer months. The apartment will have a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system. This historic preservation balances modern technology with historic preservation. The soaring ceilings coupled with the two historic mantles (non-functional),  the plaster crown molding provide an uncompromised traditional ambiance.The building,  which was originally constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  has undergone a complete historic preservation converting the structure into a super-luxury apartment complex. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating systems,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. The latest in insulation technology has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.The location is near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. A few of the restaurants which are a stone through away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Dinner. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options. The Washington Stop on the Silver Line is 200' from the property,  there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.This location offers a multitude of transportation options (silver line,  bus,  zip car,  hub way) and is ideal for medical professionals practicing at the hospital two blocks away,  professionals commuting downtown and students studying at any of the many universities in the direct vicinity. The building is also located less than ½ mile from the on ramp to I-93 allowing for easy access to regional commuting.Points of Interest:Equator : Thai Food - Mike - South End - Stella - TuroSubway Lines and Stops:SILVER - Newton St. (0.37 miles)Bus Routes and Stops:47 - Albany St Opp E Newton St (0.1 miles)10 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT3 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)8 - 91 E Concord St (0.17 miles)CT1 - 88 E Newton St (0.18 miles)16 - South Bay Mall & Office Max (0.55 miles)Contact Richard Murphy from PadMatch Realty to view this unit before it's gone!

description: @ Unit,  Elegant,  Modern, MUST SEE! Ava 6/1 (South End), 3BR, 4100, ID: 1311940Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $4100 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: June 1stBeds: 3Baths: 1Pet: No PetFeatures: Parking For RentThis large three bedroom,  one bathroom apartment is renovated with granite countertops,  stainless appliances and a new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  dish washer,  garbage disposal,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit!The apartment has a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system. The soaring ceilings and exposed brick provide an uncompromised balance of historic and traditional ambiance. There is onsite/ off street parking available as an extra.The building,  which was originally constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  has undergone a complete restoration converting the structure into a super-luxury apartment complex. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating systems,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. The latest in insulation technology,  closed cell spray in,  has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.The location is near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. A few of the restaurants which are a stone through away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Dinner. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options. Thanks.Hello potential roommate! Please take the time to READ THE ENTIRE AD CAREFULLY. Once you reach the bottom,  you will likely know if this place is the right fit for you or not. If it's the right place for you,  we're more then eager to hear from you ASAP. If not,  we wish you the best of luck with your search. Thanks a million for taking the time to read the entire ad (to save us both the time and trouble if it's not a good fit). :)GREAT LOCATION: We are two people with a spacious,  nicely furnished,  and recently renovated Victorian in a great,  safe & historical neighborhood with tree-lined streets. Seven (7) minute walk to Red Line Train (Wollaston) and to charming Wollaston Center with shops,  restaurants,  bars,  gym,  library,  post office,  etc. There is a 24 hour supermarket and a 24 hour CVS just a hop and skip away. You can even walk to the beach! Nearby Quincy Center also has lots of nightlife and diverse restaurants! Drive to Downtown Boston in just ten (10) minutes - or commute by train to Boston in just 15 minutes. Walk,  bike,  hike,  or jog at the Blue Hills; Neponset Park; or Wollaston Beach!LARGE BEDROOM: The room is large,  nicely furnished,  has hardwood floors,  brand new over-sized window; great closet space; and has cable. you can watch the sun rise/set from your bedroom window,  and has a lovely tree view. Some extra storage space might be available. (Sorry,  but the place is for INDIVIDUALS only,  not couples. :-)RENT: Of 995 includes absolutely everything: HEAT,  HOT WATER,  GAS,  ELECTRIC,  LAUNDRY,  ULTRA HIGH SPEED/BROADBAND INTERNET 100MB (fastest),  FULL CABLE (All channels + On Demand),  NETFLIX/AMAZON PRIME STREAMING; TIVO; and even a PROFESSIONAL MONTHLY CLEANING ARE ALL INCLUDED!!!TWO LEVEL HOUSE: House is immaculate,  has high ceilings and hard-wood floors throughout; lots of windows and sunshine. It has been updated and is fully furnished - from leather sofa's and artwork; to t.v and stereo,  to dishes and pots & pans,  from brand new stainless steel fridge to new washer & dryer!COMMON AREAS: There are two levels of living space with nice views of back yard,  trees,  and glimpse of ocean! The second floor common area has a living room/media room with leather furniture and a huge,  flat screen with DVD and Tivo DVR; and a fully equipped,  eat-in kitchen with brand new stainless steel fridge! One and a half bathrooms and in house laundry (new efficiency washer/dryer)!BATHS: There are 1.5 baths to share.THE CURRENT ROOMMATES ARE: (three M & F in their 20s to 30s) friendly,  busy,  considerate,  open-minded,  and responsible professionals (some are also attending grad school). Please also be easy going and drama free and able to pay rent on time! There is no smoking,  no drugs,  and no parties on the premise (although the the occasional wine or beer or two (or a few! =) is o.k.PETS: Sorry,  no pets bigger then a Guinea Pig. (Little guineas are welcome,  but don't actually have any pets at all!)AVAILABILITY: Now (Also have a bigger place for February.)EASY COMMUTE TO: Downtown Boston,  Financial District,  State Street Corp,  South Station,  U-Mass,  Suffolk University,  Northeastern University,  Berkeley,  B.U,  Emerson College,  Harvard,  MIT,  ENC,  Quincy College,  Curry College,  Baptist College,  New England School,  Tufts University,  Bay State College,  Quincy Grad Student; Mass General (MGH),  Tufts New England Medical Center,  Boston Medical (BMC),  Caritas Carney Hospital (12Minutes),  Milton Hospital,  South Shore Hospital. Click for T info: http://www.mbta.com/FIND YOUR COMMUTE: Click on the Google link below,  go to 'directions',  then click on the 'train' symbol (ALWAYS choose weekdays and 9am for accurate reading)!PARKING: Ample on street parking. On-site parking and/or garage space might also be available.FUNDS & PAYMENTS: 1st,  last,  and security deposit due at time of signing with some FLEXIBILITY (if needed) for the right person. (Normal and standard procedure in MA.)CHECKLIST: Please make sure your o.k. with the list below:1. You can leave your furniture behind (because room is rented very nicely furnished only);2. Lease - tenant at will. And we can talk about longer...3. No smoking,  drugs,  or parties - quiet,  professional house. Sorry,  no pets bigger then a Guinea Pig;4. Low-key,  drama-free,  considerate,  responsible,  clean and organized (outside of your own bedroom);5. Be able to pay the rent (only one check for everything!) on the first of every month.GET IN TOUCH: If interested,  please reply with as much info about yourself as possible,  work/school,  schedule,  moving-in time frame,  anything else you might see relevant (the more info the better). Your Likedin & Facebook link will def. speed things up! And please,  you MUST include a PHONE # since I will initially contact you via text. Sorry,  but I just don't have much time for back in forth emails! Thanks! =)ONLY TEXT MY CELL IF YOU'RE EXTREMELY INTERESTED! Or just email me. (Brookline), 3BR, 900, I am currently subletting a room in a first floor apartment at 170 Thorndike Street in North Brookline,  and it's been so great that I want to stay from September 1st 2016 to September 1st 2017. Potential tenants and I can sign a lease as soon as we have a qualifying group of 4 ready. There are three spacious,  well-lit rooms available in our four bedroom,  two bathroom apartment.Bedrooms are of varying size (but still fairly large); the smallest is $837.50,  and the two larger bedrooms are $912.50 apiece.Living room is HUGE with large bay windows and a wide doorway.Kitchen is very large and well-stocked,  with plenty of cabinet and counter space and plenty of room for four people's groceries.The two bathrooms are recently renovated and gorgeous.Heat is included,  hot water is not,  but we've got an AMAZING landlady (Ilona Sherman) and utilities come out to $50-70 max a month including cable (we've got RCN,  which is much better--and cheaper--than Xfinity). There is also NO FINDER'S FEE and NO BROKER'S FEE,  which means you just pay First Month,  Security Deposit,  and your rent.There is ample storage space in the basement,  and for laundry,  we use the laundromat on the corner opposite us,  right next to Clear Flour Bakery. This apartment is in an incredible location and comes at a price that can't be beat,  so if you're a grad student or young professional who might be interested in staying in one of the most amazing apartments in Brookline,  please PM me or text me at show contact infoPics will follow!,

description: (Massachusetts Ave)), 3BR, 4100, ID: 1311936Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $4100 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: September 1stBeds: 3Baths: 1Pet: No PetFeatures: Parking For RentEmail show contact info for showings!This large three bedroom,  one bathroom apartment is renovated with granite countertops,  stainless appliances and a new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  dish washer,  garbage disposal,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. The apartment has a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system. The soaring ceilings and exposed brick provide an un-compromised balance of historic and traditional ambiance. There is onsite/ off street parking available as an extras.The building,  which was originally constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  has undergone a complete restoration converting the structure into a super-luxury apartment complex. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating systems,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. The latest in insulation technology,  closed cell spray in,  has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.The location is near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. A few of the restaurants which are a stone through away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Dinner. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options. The Washington Stop on the Silver Line is 200' from the property,  there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.This location offers a multitude of transportation options (silver line,  bus,  zip car,  hub way) and is ideal for medical professionals practicing at the hospital two blocks away,  professionals commuting downtown and students studying at any of the many universities in the direct vicinity. The building is also located less than ½ mile from the on ramp to I-93 allowing for easy access to regional commuting.Joe Merulloshow contact infoBenjamin Apartments,  LLC

description: : Lovely furnished short term/temporary Boston accommodations (Charlestown), 1BR, 1000, I have a nicely furnished room available on a temporary basis. Mature,  open minded,  kind professional women (preferred but I'm open) welcome. Sorry,  the space is too small for couples but an occasional weekend visit can be discussed. The apartment has central A/C,  bright & sunny rooms,  great decor,  roof deck with 360-degree views,  sunset views from every window,  laundry on-site,  modern kitchen,  lots of amenities. Rent is $1000,  plus $250 to cover all utilities,  high-speed Internet and bi-weekly cleaning services for total of $1250 per month. Additional $100 upfront covers professional cleaning out and restock of home goods. If you are seeking temporary accommodations or a Boston-based second home,  I'd love to hear from you. Available Mar. 1.If you are interested in sharing my living space after reading this entire ad,  please respond with a sincere and detailed email about yourself and your needs. Please include your age and the duration of your stay. Thank you.About me & how I live:I enjoy sharing my space and occasional downtime with another good soul. The apartment is fully and very nicely furnished (as is the room for rent) and is a very calming oasis. This is a perfect place for someone seeking a temporary arrangement that feels like home. I am a woman in my late 30's,  I work in education and am an entrepreneur. I enjoy a calm,  peaceful home. I also have a 16 year old cat who lives a very leisurely life.About You:A late 30-something+ professional who is neat,  responsible,  lives a calm life and cares more about people than things. If you are in need of a place in the city,  a temporary but comfortable place for a period of time,  are seeking to live with a compassionate person and are one yourself,  I'd love to hear from you. You are a kind,  balanced and caring human being. The apartment is fully furnished and cozy,  so this is a perfect place for someone who plans to bring no more than what can fit in a 12 x 12 bedroom (surprisingly,  with a good amount of storage space within). I enjoy quiet time and genuine human connection - if you are the same,  I'd love to hear from you! Non-smokers only,  please.There is a small fee for clean out services and dry goods replenishing.About the apartment (a long list because it has a lot to offer)...- Heat,  hot water,  air conditioning,  electricity,  internet are included- Bi-weekly cleaning services (she will change sheets if needed)- In quaint Charlestown: feels like a neighborhood,  is walking distance to Whole Foods,  parks,  restaurants,  post office,  banks,  fabulous coffee shops- Quick walk or drive across the bridge to the North End or Cambridge- Walking distance to orange line T stations- #92 and #93 buses to Government Center,  Financial District & Downtown Crossing - 10-15 minute ride- #86 bus is a quick 15 minute ride to Harvard Square- Easy access to Rte. 93- 2nd floor unit with great views & tons of light- Beautiful community garden- Plenty of on-street parking- Hardwood floors and oversized windows throughout- Central air conditioning- Wireless internet- Newer remodeled kitchen,  new appliances,  dishwasher,  built-in microwave and lots of counter space- Shared bathroom but quite private and separated from living space by a long hallway- Bright eat-in kitchen is fully stocked with dishes,  juicer,  espresso maker,  gourmet cookware,  etc.- Large bathroom- End unit with tons of windows and light (sunset views from each room)- Roof deck with panoramic views of Boston,  sunset and water- Laundry in basement- Apartment nicely decorated with a lot of plants - I have a very green thumb!About the furnished room for rent:- Fairly new queen sized bed,  desk,  shelves,  lamps and dresser- Modest sized room (12x12) with a large west-facing window- Modest sized closet

description: for a Female (Back Bay), 1BR, 100, Hi there!Looking for a female sublet to share a 2 Bedroom Apartment in the heart of Back Bay. This apartment is awesome and really well located (about 5-6 cross streets from the Boston Commons)! It's a bight and sunny two bedroom home with 7 over-sized windows directly overlooking Marlborough street! It has an open and and airy designer kitchen with breakfast bar. Great living room with many windows and great views of Marlborough street. Hardwood floors throughout,  washer/dryer in unit and wall a/c unit in each bedroom. Common roof-deck & additional storage! Close to the T lines in Back bay. Sorry,  no pets allowed. There is only one bathroom,  so it would be shared.The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed with memory foam mattress. The room has a good size closet with hanging space and shelf space.A bit about me: I'm a young professional in my early-mid 20s with a stable job. I'm generally easy going,  quite,  and clean person. I am 50% extrovert and 50% introvert. I am expecting to have guests every now and then,  but would give my roommate a heads up before having anyone over. I don't smoke and/or do drugs of any sort and definitely ask that my roommate doesn't either. I will most likely be working 9-6PM and then go for a jog and/or watch TV to unwind for the night. I love to eat and drink good food,  so I go out to eat often,  but also like to cook at home. I go out for happy hours and drinks,  but I don't bring the party home.I am looking for a female sublet who is in a similar position in life both professionally and personally. description: ), 1BR, 1800, Enjoy the splendor of historic Beacon Hill in this one bedroom apartment right on Charles Street. All of Boston is at your fingertips with the Charles/MGH stop on the Red Line of the T only blocks away and the Green Line about a 10 minute walk. Grocery shop at Whole Foods on Cambridge Street,  or try the local establishments: Savenor's,  where Julia Child shopped,  at the top of Charles Street,  or DeLuca's market at the bottom. Boston Common and the Public Garden are only a couple blocks away,  and Charles Street is lined with shops boutique and antique,  along with some of the best restaurants in the city. The entrance to the Esplanade is at the top of Charles Street as well,  ideal for evening strolls along the Charles River.The apartment is on the third floor over an art gallery boasting lots of natural light through large front and rear windows and hardwood floors throughout. Crown moldings,  built-in bookshelves,  and a fireplace with mantle are indicative of the historic nature of the neighborhood while studio lighting,  a large mirror over the fireplace,  and granite in the kitchen provide contemporary accents. Built in 1850,  the building is in excellent condition.Guest AccessThe bedroom has a double bed and dresser with built-in bookshelves. The open floor plan living room/kitchen includes a queen futon,  two chairs,  a coffee table,  and dining table and chairs. The kitchen is stocked with cookware,  servingware,  plates,  glasses,  mugs,  etc.,  and includes refrigerator,  electric stove with hood,  microwave,  and dishwasher.Interaction with GuestsI look forward to welcoming you when you arrive and will be in touch to make arrangements for your arrival. Other than that,  I live about 20 minutes away but I'm available as you need me by cell,  text,  or email.The NeighborhoodBeacon Hill is quintessential Boston. One of the most historic parts of the city,  it is home to some of its most famous residents,  including John Kerry,  who lives just up the hill. Be sure to visit Boston Common and say hello to the ducklings in the Boston Garden. Go grocery shopping at Savenor's,  Julia Child's old haunt. Grab a pint at Cheers,  just around the corner. And enjoy some of the best food in town at Toscano or a laid back brunch at Paramount.Getting AroundParking is difficult on Beacon Hill,  but who would want to drive in Boston anyway? It's a walking city,  and if it's too far a walk,  the public transit is fantastic. The apartment's closest T stop is on the Red Line at Charles/MGH,  but the Boylston and Arlington stops on the Green Line are only a 10 minute walk and the Chinatown stop on the Orange Line is 12 minutes.Other Things to NoteI love Boston and love helping people get to know it. I've lived here nine years now and have a pretty good feel for the place. I'm happy help you plan your visit,  as much or as little as you like.

description: ), 1BR, 2000, Quintessential & sunny Beacon Hill 1 bedroom penthouse condo with wood-burning stove,  private balcony for al fresco dining and common roof deck! Good sized bedroom with updated bathroom and kitchen. Features an open concept living space with a kitchen island perfect for cooking,  fridge,  microwave,  oven,  dishwasher and garbage disposal. Separate eating area and large sectional sofa by the fire/tv. The condo is a 5th floor corner unit with plenty of light and great views of the Charles River,  Hancock & Prudential buildings from the bedroom and balcony. Clean,  cozy and perfect for your stay in Boston! Located in the heart of Beacon Hill on a quiet residential street,  only a block & a half away from the Charles/MGH T (subway) stop. Centrally located near MGH,  the Esplanade along the Charles River,  Charles Street & Boston Common. Wifi and cable included,  with a laundromat located directly across the (URL HIDDEN) on Beacon Hill area:Charles Street (one block away from the condo!) offers lots of quant shops and great restaurants to choose from.75 Chestnut: located on Chestnut St. on the flat of the hill. Has a very good brunch and dinner menu. Typical American food that is made to perfection. A great place to have a couple drinks and grab some food in the neighborhood.Figs: great place for casual dining right on Charles St; has delicious upscale and interesting pizzas with a quaint atmosphere. Very reasonably priced for dinner as well!Finz: best sushi in the Beacon Hill neighborhood. Located on Cambridge Street just a 10 minute walk from the apartment,  Finz has delicious and reasonably priced sushi that can be for dining in or for take out.Paramount: very popular place for breakfast in Beacon Hill,  located right on Charles St. Typical eggs,  French toast,  etc. but very delicious! Get there early though as a line often forms around 10am on the weekends.Panificio: the closest restaurant/bakery to the apartment,  right across the street on Charles St. Serves food all day. Brunch is especially delicious and is usually pretty quick to order- I recommend the Huevos Rancheros. Lunch and dinner are good as well.Upper Crust: pizza shop located at the end of Charles St closer to the park. Delicious pizza that is great for takeout.

description: ), 2BR, 1700, Mature gay couple (30's and 50's) is seeking a short-term or longer term roommate for fully furnished bedroom. Available on Feb. 3rd,  2016. Located in the historic South End of Boston... Fully furnished,  with new,  high quality beds. 1st floor bedroom (3 story loft) with private bath for $1700 per month,  all inclusive. Quiet Newcomb Street... historic P.P. Caproni Loft with high end finishes. Located 4 minutes walk away from the intersection of Washington Street & Mass Avenue,  steps to some of Boston's best restaurants. 300 feet from the Silver Line T stop (takes you downtown and to the airport) and a quick walk to Boston Medical Center and Boston University South End campus. This stunning Multi-Level 2 Bed/2.5 Bath Loft condominium is in a converted 1904 brick building. Built out to perfection,  fulfilling the wish list of most persons. Maple floors,  exposed brick walls & soaring 18 and 14 foot chestnut-beamed ceilings. Double insulation in ceilings and walls offer great sound privacy. Abundant light from enormous windows. Gas fireplace. Custom steel railings and spiral staircase to lower bedroom (see photos). Chef's kitchen with Bosch double wall convection ovens,  Sub Zero refrigerator,  Bosch dishwasher,  Silestone quartz counters,  floor-to-ceiling maple cabinetry and large breakfast bar. Custom lighting. Newer washer/dryer in unit (inside the half bathroom). Master bedroom with unique en suite French limestone bath with multiple shower-heads and a hand held. Large second bedroom with unique en suite onyx tiled bath. Half bath off of kitchen/living area. Formal dining room adjacent to kitchen. Wired for sound in most rooms. Storage area for luggage. One full gated parking space included in rent,  located right next to the side entry door. Some of the additional features are a large custom made,  Zebra wood dining room table that easily seats 6 to 8,  an eight foot tall 19th century stain glass window over the fireplace,  custom cherry master bedroom bureaus and matching bathroom vanity and assorted original antique paintings,  prints and objet d'art. Central air conditioning/heat. One month minimum stay. Two month or longer stays discounted by $100 per month. $500 security deposit. If you stay two months or longer a last month's rent deposit is required. Quiet building with mostly owner occupants. Contact owner/roommate if you are highly qualified with excellent references and credit. No couples please. For your information: One of the roommates is living in Florida for the winter and the other works full time and goes to Harvard part-time at night,  so lots of privacy.Paul/owner. Thank you. show contact info

description: ), 2BR, 800, I am a senior (m) about to graduate with my BFA in Painting. I have a beautiful loft in Union Square,  Somerville with an extra room and I'm looking to find a cool roommate. The loft has 14ft ceilings,  10Ft tall windows with a beautiful view,  washer and dryer,  and art gallery in complex,  located in a very cool artists community (which also includes many scientists as we are right near MIT). My loft is fully furnished except the room,  bring a bed etc with you. Unlike most of Somerville there is extensive parking available here with a residents permit and you can rent a dedicated spot for a very reasonable rate here on the property. Heat,  hot water,  trash pick up,  on site management during business hours,  plowing all included in the rent. I do not subscribe to cable TV,  I choose instead to keep it simple and just have internet services in my home. The second room,  which is the roommate bedroom,  is a loft style space and I will work with my new roommate to close it off for more privacy. Other details about this unique place can be discussed in person. As for pets,  I have one kitten and cannot add any additional pets.If you are interested,  please write to me with details about yourself,  how you like to have your home set up,  what you would prefer/dislike in a roommate situation.In the backyard of MIT,  close to Harvard,  ample bike and car parking,  beautiful community outdoor space,  on site art gallery and artists association. Across from Star Market,  Target,  Golds Gym,  quick walk to Lechemere T green line,  Sullivan Sq orange line,  and many buses (CT2 express to Longwood/MassArt/Mass College of Pharmacy,  Harvard Medical) etc). Only 2 miles to the heart of downtown boston,  a few blocks from 93. A 12-15 minute bike ride to BU Boston University Charles River campus. Kendall Square,  close to Museum of Science,  Inman and Central Square as well.

description: 'T GET BETTER! 2BR w Central AIRUNIT LAUND,  Private ROOF DECK (South End - 9/1/16), 2BR, 3300, ID: 1081525Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $3300 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: September 1stBeds: 2Baths: 1Pet: No PetFeatures: A/C Alcove Central Air Ceramic Tiles Deck Dishwasher Disposal Eat-in Kitchen Fireplace (Decorative) Granite Counter Tops Hardwood Floors High Ceiling Laundry in Unit Microwave Modern Bath Modern Kitchen New/Renovated Bath New/Renovated Kitchen New Appliances Private Roof Deck Stainless Steel Appliance(s) StorageEnormous Garden Level Two Bed,  One Bath Apartment with Private Landscaped Garden/ Patio in South End.This large two bedroom apartment is fully renovated with granite countertops,  stainless appliances garbage disposal,  and a new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  dish washer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a large private garden level patio dedicated solely to this apartment. The patio area is perfect for outdoor entertaining and is landscaped with patio pavers and has a beautiful mature oak provide a nice shade in the summer months. The apartment has a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system.he building,  which was originally constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  has undergone a complete historic preservation converting the structure into a super-luxury apartment complex. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating systems,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. The latest in insulation technology has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.The location is near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. A few of the restaurants which are a stone through away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Dinner. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options. The Washington Stop on the Silver Line is 200' from the property,  there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.This location offers a multitude of transportation options (silver line,  bus,  zip car,  hub way) and is ideal for medical professionals practicing at the hospital two blocks away,  professionals commuting downtown and students studying at any of the many universities in the direct vicinity. description: 1 train stop away! (Boston), 4BR, 3195, Single family home with lots of space and privacy,  yet in a very desirable and central part of Eastie,  in between 2 Blue Line T stops. Downtown Boston is only 1 or 2 stops away! A private 2-level home of your own to rent in emaculate condition,  with your own private balcony/patio,  plus private yard,  with all of the amenities of a cozy home: air conditioning,  laundry inside,  elegant bamboo flooring,  contemporary and comfortable,  with extra storage in spacious basement. All that,  and very close to South Boston Waterfront Seaport District,  Faneul Hall,  Quincy Marketplace,  Financial District,  and all of Boston's finest pubs and restaurants easily accessible.This home has many updates such as a large kitchen with all stainless steel appliances,  beautiful cabinets,  gas stove/oven,  bamboo floors,  plenty of contemporary ceiling fans throughout,  in addition to working wall AC units that keep the place cool in the summer. It also has a brand new large LG washer and dryer,  and plenty of storage space in the basement,  along with a private deck and it's own private cemented yard (no mowing necessary to maintain) for outdoor enjoyment. The home has efficient heating as well to keep bills lower during winter months.Its located 1 minute walk to Boston's historical and famous Santarpios Pizza,  as well as all of the new restaurants and amenities East Boston has to offer including Bremen Park,  YMCA gym (just a 2 minute walk),  brand new state-of-the-art contemporary library (4 minute walk),  as well as trails to harbor,  and the East Boston Waterfront,  which is developing even more than ever. The waterfront area from Hyatt to Piers Park to Lupresi Park,  boasts some of the best views of Boston as well as sailing,  picnics,  and places to walk/jog with beautiful scenery.Newly renovated Maverick T and Airport T are short walks (5 to 8 minutes),  and Jeffries Point/Maverick Square has become an extremely popular and convenient choice for young professionals who want the proximity to Boston,  with the convenience of nearby amenities that this quiet/safe neighborhood has to offer.One year lease required.Total payment (first,  last,  and security deposit) due at lease signing.Available immediately for August 15th or Sept 1st (if available). Come see this home and reserve soon!

description: 'Reduced' Single family home on 5 acres (Wesley,  Maine), 3BR, 79900, This is a cozy New England Farm home that sits on 5 acres of land and has its own small apple orchard in the backyard.May consider owner financing with half of the asking price down.Asking price: $79, 900Address: 4697 Airline Road,  Wesley ME. 04686Bedrooms: 3-4 all upstairsBathrooms: 1Square Footage: 1500The house was built in the early 1900's. In the mid 1970's the house was totally stripped down to the frame and remodeled,  including the partial stone foundation. The owners who had the house totally remodeled in the 70's have since passed away. The home has been well taken care of.A new 1000-gallon septic system was installed 1999New roof installed 2008Insulation blown in attic and basement joists in 2008Storm windows installed.Forced air oil-burning heater serviced and cleaned by V.L. Tammaro Oil Co. in March 2015.Water Softener serviced in March 2015 and is attached to a private well.The property is on a hill and doesn't have any low-lying water problems. Additionally,  the property is level around the house with plenty of room to add a detached garage. Off the master bedroom is a smaller room that can be used as a sewing room,  storage,  nursery,  and can also be converted to a private bathroom.The house has a nice size living room. Adjacent to the living room is an oversized sitting area with a sliding glass door that over looks the apple trees and backyard. There is a full size basement that has a workbench and an area that was used for baking with sink,  countertop,  and shelving. The house is ready to move in and the property has potential for a large garage,  horse property and areas large enough for gardens and livestock.

description: @Unit,  Gr8 Loca~Ava 9/1 (South End), 4BR, 6000, ID: 2144451Location: Massachusetts Ave.,  Boston (South End)Rent: $6000 / MonthBroker Fee: No Fee!Available Date: 09/01/2016Beds: 4Baths: 2Pet: NegotiableFeatures: A/C,  Balcony,  Central Air,  Dishwasher,  Disposal,  Exposed Brick,  Granite Counter Tops,  Hardwood Floors,  Laundry in Unit,  Microwave,  Modern Bath,  Modern Kitchen,  New Appliances,  New/Renovated Bath,  New/Renovated Kitchen,  Pantry,  Private Roof Deck,  Stainless Steel Appliance(s)Massive Four Bedroom,  Two Bathroom Newly Constructed Apartment in South End!The most attractive feature of this unique upper level apartment is the massive open floor plan of the living,  dining and kitchen area overlooking the City of Boston. The floor to ceiling windows wrapping the building's corner toward the intersection of Mass Ave./ Washington Street provide spectacular panoramic views of the Boston skyline. Enjoy wonderful views down Massachusetts Avenue into the South End and beyond.This spacious upper level four bedroom,  two bathroom apartment balances the historic character of the original industrial building with the contemporary modern finishes and amenities. This unit is equipped with the latest in urban utilities. This large two bedroom apartment features a beautifully equipped kitchen with all new stainless steel appliances,  granite countertops with waterfall ends,  a garbage disposal,  a dishwasher and a bar roomy enough to seat three.The dining area features a built in hutch/ bar for dining ware/ cocktail storage. This high level unit receives spectacular sun and long views from all common areas and private bedrooms. There are hardwood floors throughout the apartment.The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  central heating and air conditioning. The unit is also furnished with an on demand gas fired hot water heater as well as a high efficiency boiler. Parking is available at an additional cost.The redevelopment of this property has brought this historic gem of the South End back to life. Located near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  this building is in the heart of restaurant row in Boston's South End! A few of the highly acclaimed restaurants which are a stone's throw away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Diner. description: .,  3 min. from T,  great for MIT/Harvard/Tufts (Somerville), 1BR, 985, Large,  270 ft^2 bedroom,  on the third floor of a two-apartment house in charming Davis Square,  Somerville. The bedroom is part of a 4 bed/2br apartment,  shared by 3 other people.The bedroom has a closet,  and ample space for a bed and other equipment like a desktop computer and desks. While the bedroom will be unfurnished,  the rest of the apartment is fully furnished with a large living room,  including a 55' flat screen television and wireless internet access; a large dining room,  great for breakfast in the morning and dinner with friends at night; a large kitchen with a full assortment of pots and pans,  knives and baking equipment; two full bathrooms,  one just feet away from the bedroom for rent,  and the other downstairs,  so scheduling in the morning is never an issue; two porches,  front and back; a driveway leading to a garage,  which is currently housing motorcycles,  but is great for an avid hobbyist and accompanying projects; and a washer/dryer in the basement.The apartment is situated across from a lovely park,  which is great for sunny afternoon frisbee or picnics. Additionally,  the MBTA Davis Square Red Line stop is only a 3 minute walk,  making it an easy 16-minute commute to MIT,  or a 8-minute commute to Harvard. There is also quick and easy access to the northern Boston suburbs via buses from the Alewife station,  making this apartment an excellent opportunity for interns in the Cambridge/Somerville/north Boston area. Finally,  the apartment is also only 6 minutes away from Davis Square,  which offers an eclectic variety of venues,  including BBQ and vegan restaurants,  a comedy club,  an array of bars for dancing and nightlife,  as well as a lovely,  independently owned movie theater - the best in Boston!The monthly rent is $985,  with a cost for utilities and cable/internet (in Summer months,  this is less than a hundred dollars),  which can be prorated for your time staying. My roommates are two engineers and a mental health professional,  and we are planning to move out at the end of the summer,  so there is an opportunity for you to extend the lease if you're interested.Please tell us a little about yourself in your message so we can see if this could be a good fit.
